page.title: 13The Jubilee Jungle.Exford
page.content: Beside the Infant classroom there used to be a rough field but in 1977 we decided to make it into a consevation area. It is called Jubillee Jungle to remember the Queen's silver Jubillee and Jungle because we let part of the grass grow long, so we can study wildlife and nature. The National Park gave us trees and seats. Some teenage offenders built a pond instead of going to prison. In the pond we have waterlillies, tadpoles,waterboatmen newts and all sorts of creatures, it is inrteresting going pond dipping. The infants feed the birds and we see many different kinds, especially in winter when they are hungry.There are about four paths going through the long grass to the centre,we go hunting mini beasts like ladybirds and worms.
